bio.experienceSummary:
Hi! I'm a medical student currently taking a research year while also studying for my boards. With years of experience babysitting and part-time nannying for children throughout college, graduate school, and medical school, I've become the go-to caregiver for families in my community.

My experience includes caring for multiple children at a time, engaging in fun activities (I love to bake, do crafts, engage in outdoor activities, etc.), meal prep, and light housekeeping. I've also tutored in Science, Math (up to Algebra), and Spanish (grammar, reading, and writing).

Certified in Basic Life Support (CPR/First Aid) by the American Heart Association (valid through 12/2025).

Comfortable with pets and happy to assist with their care for an additional fee.
My ultimate goal is to support families by providing reliable childcare tailored to your parenting style and values

description.originalText: My husband and I are so grateful to have met Khyla and have her as our babysitter for 2 years. I cannot recommend her enough! She is reliable, punctual, and truly cares about the well-being and happiness of our children. Khyla has a warm and kind demeanor that instantly puts us at ease, and our children absolutely adore her. Do not hesitate to connect with and hire her!

bio.experienceSummary:
Hi there! I'm a former English teacher, former full-time nanny, and soon-to-be nursing student splitting my time between freelance marketing and studying, and ****I'm looking for date night / non-recurring babysitting jobs to balance out my busy schedule.****

I love reading, crafting, baking, playing outside, and dinosaurs (roooar!) I make a great dance party DJ and am very good at making up silly songs. 

Above all, I'm patient, imaginative, and kind. I genuinely love caring for people--which is why I'm making the pivot from marketing to nursing. My experience ranges from babysitting/nannying for 20+ years to being an English teacher for ages 4-16 in China.

I'm currently based on the Upper West Side and would ideally like to find families that are nearby. I would be happy to supply references upon request!

Hello! My name is Maya, and I am looking for part-time and occasional babysitting jobs!  I have 10 years of paid experience, and am CPR certified. I am fully vaccinated and graduated from  University. I am finishing my Master's degree. I have experience with all ages, and multiple kids. I can prepare simple meals, tidy up, and open to discuss other tasks. I am a friendly, attentive, flexible, kind, caring, and experienced babysitter and, would love to help your family! Thanks!

description.originalText: Maya was communicative up to the date we needed her, punctual and friendly. Our son is older but wanted some company for him  while we were out in the evening visiting the city and was a perfect match for us. Recommended for an easy and stress free experience. Thanks!

bio.experienceSummary: Hi! I'm Lindsey. I'm originally from Weston, Florida. I went to the University of Miami and graduated in 2019. After college, I lived in Spain for 3 years teaching English to elementary school students, so I have lots of experience working with children! I'd love to help out on the occasional date night or weekend if needed. Looking forward to hearing from you!

Hi, As a dedicated and experienced childcare professional, I'm passionate about providing top-notch care and support to new parents and their little ones. With over 10 years of experience working with children from birth to 12 years old, I've honed my skills in creating a safe, nurturing environment that promotes healthy development.
My Background: 8 years as a preschool teacher, Experienced nanny for children of all ages, Specialized training in newborn care, postpartum support,

Services: Day and Night Newborn Care: including feeding, diaper changes, and sleep routine establishment, Personalized sleep plans tailored to your baby's needs and family lifestyle. Virtual / Person Consultations: Newborn care basics, postpartum recovery, feeding support, and emotional support. Occasional Date Night Services as well.
If you're looking for expert care, guidance, and peace of mind during this precious time, I'm here to help.

description.originalText: Suja was wonderful! She was on time and very professional. My kids loved her, and she was patient when they had a hard time with bedtime (traveling from another time zone). Will definitely work with her again!

bio.experienceSummary: I am an energetic 28-year-old psychology student at Columbia & nanny/babysitter looking for jobs in the NYC area. I live in Hell's Kitchen and I have 6 years of professional experience with kids age 0-15. I am dedicated, reliable, and trustworthy, I am willing to help with homework/homeschooling, light housekeeping, meal preparation, laundry, arranging playdates and suitable activities, school/activities pick up and drop off, and much more. I'm available during the evenings and weekends for babysitting.

description.originalText: Carol was wonderful with our 11 month old son. She handled dinner and bedtime like a pro! We will definitely use her services again!

bio.experienceSummary: Hi, my name is Shakiyla, and I am 27 years old and live in Brooklyn, New York. I have eight years of babysitting and nannying experience. I started nannying in 2015 until I graduated in 2018 with a Bachelor of Science in Public Administration. In 2019 I decided to put my degree to use and started working at a preschool for children with autism. I was a Teacher's Aide and then transitioned to Executive Assistant. Both positions were part-time, and I needed a full-time job. I left the preschool and worked as an Assistant Director at a tutoring center. At the tutoring center, I worked with children K-12 and managed part-time teachers. I left my job at the tutoring center and started nannying again for a year. I am now pursuing a master's degree in early childhood education birth-2nd grade.

description.originalText: Shakiyla has been great to work with and very dependable. She has worked our companies last two bring your child to work day events. We canâ€™t wait to have her work our next event!

bio.experienceSummary: Hi, my name is Selma. I am an experienced nanny and babysitter that has been working since I was 16. I have been a live in nanny twice and throughly enjoyed my time. I am currently working in the entertainment industry as a Coordinator at Warner Brothers and am looking for additional work on the weekends. I love children! I love playing dress up, making arts and crafts, baking, and more. I am a great sitter that is devoted to enriching the lives of your kids and having a lot of fun.

description.displayText: Selma spreads pure joy when she walks into the room. She is openhearted, easy to talk to, and will love on your kiddos like they were her own. I have a 4 and 2 year old and 3 month old that she has cared for this past year. She also lived with us this past summer and watched both the 4 and 2 year old. Selma took them to parks, libraries, and snuggled them when they needed it. You won't be disappointed!
description.originalText: Selma spreads pure joy when she walks into the room. She is openhearted, easy to talk to, and will love on your kiddos like they were her own. I have a 4 and 2 year old and 3 month old that she has cared for this past year. She also lived with us this past summer and watched both the 4 and 2 year old. Selma took them to parks, libraries, and snuggled them when they needed it. You won't be disappointed!

bio.experienceSummary:
Hi! My name is Emily  and I'm a current graduate student at Columbia. I moved to NYC from LA in 2021 and am very comfortable with getting around the city and have experience babysitting both in New York and beyond!

I have 15 years of experience caring for children of all ages, from infants to teenagers. I'm comfortable caring for up to five children at a time and have experience with children with special needs. I'm also willing to help with cooking, meal preparation, carpooling, light housekeeping, travel, and swimming supervision.

I believe in fostering a safe, nurturing, and educational environment for children. I'm patient, calm, creative, and friendly, and I know how to communicate effectively with parents about their child's day or any issues that arise. I'm also comfortable enforcing household rules and following the parents' lead.

I'm certified in First Aid and CPR, and I'm always looking for ways to improve my skills and knowledge.

Hello, I'm a mom and also a prek teacher, I also have my masters in early childhood education and I am well versed and certified in CPR. I have worked with children from all ages for almost 2 decades. I have experience in all things, whether it is from light house keeping to special needs children. I am looking for weekend / evening work as a side gig. Thank you for reading!
